page.title: 11BIRD-COUNT IN HARBOUR
page.content:
{-including Carreg yr Imbyll(Gimblet {Rock) { Depth-(Max. spring-rise & fall)-3.5m. Yachts & boats moored July 1985:- Inner Harbour - >100 Outer Harbour - >300 {Area contains freshwater reedbeds and {estuary tidal mudflats and estuarine {birds. At low-tide (Oct.-Apr.) the {exposed mudflats provide feeding {grounds for many species of waders. {The most readily observed being:-
(CODE: 1{1-10 sightings per annum. 2{11-100 p.a.,}3{101-1000 p.a., 4{1001-10000 p.a.}) CURLEW(3);DUNLIN(4);REDSHANK(4); GREENSHANK(2);KNOTT(2);TURNSTONE(2); GREY(2),RINGED(3)and GOLDEN(3) PLOVER; BAR(3)and BLACK-TAILED(2) GODWIT; OYSTERCATCHER(3);COMMON SANDPIPER(2).
